title: [K-12] Innovative Language Learning Design Using an Open Educational Quality Framework: Enhancing Textual, Expressive, and Reading Competencies and Cultivating Intercultural Communication Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language learning theories (grammar/vocabulary/reading/expression), digital tool experience, OER-based project design experience, foundational intercultural communication competence
context.additional_context: A course focusing on designing and evaluating language projects using Open Educational Resources (OER): Emphasizes text analysis, creative expression, and intercultural communication competency. Learners develop communication skills in real language contexts (e.g., digital storytelling, role-playing) and continuously improve writing and speaking abilities through a feedback system.

learning_goals: Learners can explain 5 core elements (goal clarity, activity diversity, assessment systematicity, resource accessibility, interactivity) constituting the 3 dimensions (learning design, process, outcomes) of an open educational quality framework, and present ≥3 cases applying each dimension to language learning projects (e.g., English role-play, vocabulary game development) with ≥2 points (out of 3) on evaluation rubrics (validity, specificity, effectiveness).

Develop a language learning quality assessment checklist by modifying the ISO/IEC 40180 standard process model: including grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension evaluation items and intercultural communication competency evaluation items.

Completion and presentation of an open-resource-based language project (e.g., fostering intercultural communication skills through multilingual digital storytelling) via PBL (Project-Based Learning) approach: integrating text analysis, creative expression, and collaborative skills

Proposing improvement strategies for a language project (e.g., writing feedback system) using a macro-meso-micro three-tier quality management model: strengthening integrated listening-speaking-writing assessment and applying feedback rubrics

resources: Access to OER (Open Educational Resources) databases

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
